TopicTitle: [WIP][1.9.x-1.12.x] Scatterer-atmospheric scattering (0.0838 - 14/08/2022) Scattering improvements, in-game atmo generation and multi-sun support

Articles.Content:

> 
> Yes, use the 0.0320b release, although i am not sure why i have to mention that. If you followed the installation instructions you should have read that...

I believe you have to mention that because 0.0320b is not available for download anywhere on github

[https://github.com/PhineasFreak/RSSVE/wiki/Installation](https://github.com/PhineasFreak/RSSVE/wiki/Installation) (check out the mod version list in the **installation instructions** page)

>

> 5 hours ago, Speedbird52 said:
> 
> 
> because 0.0320b is not available for download anywhere on github
> 

Not all mods necessarily have GitHub releases and there are other ways to get KSP mods. One of them is [SpaceDock](https://spacedock.info/kerbal-space-program), an awesome community modding site for hosting mods: [https://spacedock.info/mod/141/scatterer](https://spacedock.info/mod/141/scatterer)

A proper bug report might help..

Installed scatter, default config, and sunflare thing for KSP 1.4.5 through <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>. 

This made the ocean pitch black at night while looking at it from <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> view.

Uninstalling scatterer made the ocean dark blue at night again....

> 
> 
> 1 hour ago, JoE Smash said:
> 
> 
> Installed scatter, default config, and sunflare thing for KSP 1.4.5 through <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>.

That’s because scatterer makes the ocean pitch black at night.

> 
> 
> 27 minutes ago, Galileo said:
> 
> 
> That’s because scatterer makes the ocean pitch black at night.
> 

But why? Then you can't see it....it's scary...

Have you ever been above water at night? It’s pretty damn black. You might catch a glimmer of the moon in real life, but scatterer doesn’t simulate that, so you are left with black.

![0DykOQt.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/0DykOQt.jpg)

![VAsCH5D.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/VAsCH5D.jpg)

Hi you've just joined the millions of others who find the sea a scary place. As a crunchy, easily digestable,  bite sized biped  it's only natural ( say hi to your inner caveman for me ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)") )\_  It's blacker than black. on a moonless night. out of sight of land, the only light is the occasional reflection of the ship lights upon breaking waves and perhaps the wake, and if you're really lucky, at the right time of year  a faint phosphorescence in the disturbed water   

Spoiler

Sure if you like navigating through menus and having to hit Apply to see the results of every tweak

Turn off "real sky reflections" in the main menu options and then Mod+F11 to open the settings window in the flight scene and mess around with all the water settings. Try changing the colors.
